What is the Voter Information Pamphlet & Sample Ballot? The San Francisco Voter Information Pamphlet & Sample Ballot provides official, non-partisan information about local candidates, ballot measures, and voting options. By law, we must mail a pamphlet to every registered voter. This means that all voters living in the same household will receive duplicate copies of the pamphlet unless they take action. The impact of paper pamphlets. For the November 2022 election, the Department of Elections printed over 460,000 copies of a 250-page pamphlet, at a cost of more than $1,000,000 and 177 tons of paper. The November 2024 pamphlet is expected to be even longer! If you live with other voters, please consider reducing paper use by sharing one pamphlet. All but one household member can opt out of mail delivery and you will still receive one paper copy to share. To learn more about Voter Information Pamphlet production costs, watch this video . Ready to Go Green? It's easy to stop receiving a pamphlet in the mail: Log in to the Voter Portal , Email your request, or Call us at 415-554-4375. How to access the online pamphlet: We post the online pamphlet about 40 days before an election in PDF , HTML , and MP3 formats. If you request to stop mail delivery, we will send you a link to the pamphlet when it is ready. You can choose to either get a link through email or a postcard with a QR code. How to access other formats of the pamphlet: We also produce the pamphlet in these accessible formats: Large print Audio on USB flash drive Audio on CD Call 415-554-4375, TTY 415-554-4368, or email us to submit your request for an accessible pamphlet. You can also get a talking book pamphlet and a free audio player at the Talking Books and Braille Center. It is located on the second floor of the main library at 100 Larkin Street.
